intro: Oncoba longipes, commonly known as the long-fruited oncoba, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are elongated pods that split open to release seeds. Oncoba longipes is often found in wetland or riparian habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
